item.title: Monthly Reoccurring Flyripping Below CCTV, 11th July
item.description:
Every 3-4 weeks (sometimes more frequently) a van load of rubbish With address labels typically household waste, packing, broken furniture etc is dump on the corner of Maury road and Evering Road. This is below the public CCTV Cameras.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Evering Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Removal of width restriction posts, 11th July
item.description:
Due to recent work on the north end road, these restrictions were lifted to allow larger vehicles to pass along Slade Green road. This has been horrible. The noise and speed of them day and night has been awful for local residents and the danger to school children crossing the road has been exacerbated no end. As the skip lorries and works vehicles bump over the speed bumps on the road from 4am, it wakes everyone up and sounds like an accident happening half the time. Please replace these posts ASAP to allow our lives to go back to normal.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Slade Green Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on pavement, 11th July
item.description:
Rubbish on Matfield Road beside recycling bins. There are two council bins which have been dumped there and have been there for some time now which are also full. There must be food waste in some of the bags because the flys are around it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Streamway, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A local resident left his house front, and left these bin bags in front of my house and refused to remove them back to his own house front., 11th July
item.description:
When I noticed the littering and defacement of my property, I pressed their doorbell and his wife answered and said it was bags with clothes for charity. I stated clearly that even in that case the bags should be left in front of their own house. They should communicate clearly with the charity agency instead of littering and defacing someone else's house in their propaganda disguised as charity. At first the wife went to remove the bags, but then her husband refused. He stated that it's a 'public pavement'. I understand that it's a public pavement. However, the government made the pavement for pedestrians to walk on. I have no problems with that all. This man is actually obstructing the rightful use of the pavement and almost covering a public signpost. If foxes get at those bags, the clothes will be all over the street and may even cover the signpost. Potentially causing danger. It is also defacing the front view of my property. All this because an anti social individual left his own house, went across across the road to do a public display of charity through harassing others. This is inappropriate and a misuse of the act of charity. It is unacceptable behaviour to refuse to remove the bags back to his own house front. This man should be warned to respect his boundaries and that it is not civilised to dictate to others how their house front view should look. I look forward to your response. Thanks you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashurst Close, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cardboard boxes has been dumped, 11th July
item.description:
A substantial pile of flattened cardboard boxes has been dumped on the pavement and has remained there for more than a month. Despite its prolonged presence, the waste has not been cleared. I kindly request that the council investigate and arrange for its removal as soon as possible or ask the Shikari Beauty to sort it out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Merrow Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two trees, 11th July
item.description:
There are 2 trees located at the back of my garden fence - the roots will grow under and the trees will get bigger ultimately damaging my fencing to my back garden - I don’t know who owns the land at the back it appears to be garages - is it possible to get the trees fully removed - there weeds all intertwined with them that grow through my fence - I have to remove them to avoid damage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sherwood Close, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
